<< tril elementary functions uminus >>

triu

Upper triangular part of matrix

Syntax

T = triu(M)
T = triu(M, k)

Input argument

M

2D input matrix

k

Diagonals to include: integer real value

Output argument

R

Upper Triangular Portions of Matrix

Description

triu computes Upper Triangular Portions of Matrix.

R = triu(M, k) returns the elements on and above the kth diagonal of M.

Example

x = [1+i,-i;i,2i];
r = triu(x)

See also

diag.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET
